Summary

Biography

2019: A CoSIDA Academic All-District nominee ... was a GLIAC All-Academic Team selection ... pitched in 14 games out of the bullpen ... finished with a 2-1 record and a 3.98 ERA ... tied for the team lead with three saves ... struck out 19 batters in 20 and 1/3 innings ... struck out three batters in two and 1/3 innings and did not allow a run vs. Hillsdale (2/16) to earn his first career save ... worked two scoreless innings against Tiffin (2/22) ... kept TU (2/24) scoreless with a season-best four strikeouts to pick up his second save ... appeared versus Dartmouth (3/14) and did not allow a hit or a run over an inning and 2/3 to lower his ERA to 2.00 ... won first game of the season vs. UM-Dearborn (3/20) and allowed a run in an inning of work ... pitched a season-high three innings at Parkside (4/20) and struck out four batters, while not allowing a run to collect his second win of the year ... worked a perfect frame against Saginaw Valley State (5/4) ... continued to perform well against SVSU (5/5) with two scoreless innings ... pushed scoreless innings streak to eight with a scoreless frame against Davenport (5/10) at the GLIAC Tournament ... pitched against Drury (5/17) in the NCAA Midwest Regional and allowed two earned runs ... Game-by-Game Stats.

2018: Named to the GLIAC All-Academic Team ... made seven relief appearances ... finished with a 7.88 ERA and struck out six batters over eight innings ... opponents hit .258 against the left-hander ... allowed runs in five of his seven outings ... worked a scoreless 1/3 of an inning vs. Pace (3/14) ... worked a season-high two and 2/3 innings against Tiffin (4/12) and did not allow a run and struck ot a season-best four batters ...Game-by-Game Stats.

2017: Named to the GLIAC All-Academic Team ... appeared in 11 games and struck out 21 batters over 24 and 2/3 innings ... went 2-0 with a 5.11 ERA ... walked just five batters ... did not allow a run to the eventual national champions, West Chester (3/15) over three and 2/3 innings and struck out six batters ... earned his first collegiate victory at Ohio Dominican (4/5) by allowing one run over four and a 1/3 innings with three Ks ... improved to 2-0 with a win over Ashland (4/8), tossing four and a 1/3 innings ... lowered ERA to 3.52 with 2/3 of an inning against Hillsdale (4/12) ... did not allow a run in 2/3 of an inning vs. Quincy (5/21) in the NCAA Midwest Regional ... Game-by-Game Stats.

2016: Appeared in six games out of the bullpen ... allowed four earned runs in four innings (9.00 ERA) ... struck out five batters and walked two ... opponents hit .250 off the left-hander ... did not allow a run in final four outings of season, allowing just one base runner ... recorded a strikeout in five of six appearances ... allowed an earned run in a 1/3 of an inning in collegiate debut vs. Minnesota Duluth (3/11) ... did not allow a run in 2/3 of an inning at Ohio Dominican (4/2) ... pitched a scoreless frame versus Lake Erie (4/16) ... struck out a batter in 2/3 of an inning where he did not allow a run at Northwood (4/23) ... concluded season with a perfect inning vs. Malone (5/8) ...Game-by-Game Stats.

High School: A 2015 graduate of John Glenn High School ... played four seasons and earned a letter each of those seasons for the Rockets and head coach Lawrence Scheffer ... the left-handed pitcher and outfielder was the team’s Offensive MVP and Cy Young award winner as a senior ... was named a 2015 First Team All-Area selection by the Observer and Eccentric ... was voted to the All-Conference, All-District and All-Region teams in 2015 ... was an All-District Scholar honoree in 2014 ... lists his top individual performance at the plate as a 3-for-4 game with two triples and five RBI ... his top pitching performance was a no-hitter against Lincoln Park and shutout versus Plymouth ... also lettered twice in football as a quarterback and served as a captain.

Personal: Full name--Brendan A. Wetmore ... son of Jason and Jaclyn Wetmore ... born on May 15, 1997 in Wayne, Mich. ... is a Global Supply Chain Management major ... named to the Athletic Director's Honor Roll (term GPA 3.5+) for Fall 2016, Winter 2017, Winter 2018 and Fall 2018 ... named to the Coach's Honor Roll (term GPA 3.0-3.49) for Fall 2015 and Winter 2019.

No stats available for the current season.
